description: An alternate reality version of feudal Japan, based on the Edo period. In this reality, One Piece characters take on different roles - Luffy is a detective/okapikki, Buggy runs a crime family, and Vivi is the shogun's daughter. The setting features traditional Japanese architecture, social hierarchies, and cultural elements from 19th century Japan.

keyEvents.title: Introduction to Jipangu's Power Structure
keyEvents.description: The episode establishes the alternate reality setting with its feudal power structure.
keyEvents.significance: First appearance of this alternate universe setting.

keyEvents.title: Rika's Kidnapping
keyEvents.description: Buggy kidnaps Rika in Jipangu to collect Tot-san's debts.
keyEvents.significance: Central conflict takes place in this location.

keyEvents.title: Vivi Exposes Corruption
keyEvents.description: The shogun's daughter Vivi reveals the corrupt official's crimes and strips him of power.
keyEvents.significance: Justice is restored to Jipangu's government.

reveals.information: Alternate reality based on Edo period Japan where One Piece characters exist in different roles
Governed by a shogun with various officials, though corruption exists within the government
Has okapikki (secret police/detectives) like Luffy who fight crime
Organized crime families exist, such as Buggy's Clown Family

culturalSignificance: Jipangu serves as a creative reimagining of One Piece characters in a feudal Japanese setting, allowing for exploration of alternate character dynamics and roles. The name 'Jipangu' is a historical European name for Japan.

description: A restaurant in Jipangu co-owned by Nami (called Onami) and Sanji. This represents their occupation in the alternate feudal Japanese reality.

reveals.information: Restaurant co-owned by Nami and Sanji in the Jipangu alternate reality

culturalSignificance: Shows how Nami and Sanji's roles are reimagined in the feudal setting, with both maintaining food-related occupations.
